alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cheshire, northwestern Hillsborough and southeastern Merrimack Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 925 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hopkinton to near Antrim to near Westminster. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concord, Keene, Henniker, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston, Epsom, Antrim, Canterbury, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Dublin, Francestown, Bennington, Harrisville, Nelson, Gilsum, Marlborough, Hancock and Deering. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 93 between mile markers 31 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cheshire; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough
